items.description: Development of applications with React (Vite) and Next.js, applying architecture best practices and domain-driven organization. Interface implementation with Tailwind CSS, building reusable and standardized components (design system foundation). Implementation of complex layouts and strategic screens with focus on performance and UX. API integration and state management with React Query. Work with Server Components and SSR in Next.js. Continuous alignment with Tech Lead for technical solutions and prioritization. Active participation in code reviews, technical refinements, and architecture decisions. Technical leadership with mentoring and code reviews with the team.

items.role: Full Systems Analyst / Frontend Technical Leader
items.description: I worked as a frontend technical reference within a consulting firm that serves large companies. My role went beyond coding: I participated in architecture definitions, performed detailed code reviews focusing on performance and security, and closely monitored the evolution of more junior developers with recurring mentoring. Constant collaboration with multidisciplinary squads.

I worked at a fintech company that served over 100,000 users, developing both the mobile app and the web platform. One of the projects I am most proud of was creating a shared design system between Web and Mobile, which brought visual consistency and accelerated delivery. I also made optimizations that improved the Lighthouse score by about 40%.

This is where I matured significantly as a developer. I built complex features always with scalability and user experience in mind. I implemented WCAG accessibility in the most critical components of the product and led a major refactoring of the legacy codebase, improving maintainability and reducing recurring bugs.

My first comprehensive experience working with front-end and back-end. I developed REST APIs, microservices, and web interfaces with React and Next.js. It was here that I began to truly understand how the front-end connects with all the engineering behind it.

I started in technical support and gradually moved into development on my own, studying TERM3x0 and TERM4x0 in my spare time. I ended up taking on the maintenance and development of the company's web system in the healthcare area. That's where it all started and where I built a solid foundation.
